main_definition: When not referring to the baked dessert, 'cakes' can be an informal idiom representing different things based on context.

meanings_and_examples.example: After losing the game, he said it was just a cake - meaning it didn't really matter.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To celebrate an event by gathering people together
meanings_and_examples.example: We decided to throw a surprise party for her birthday. It was all hands on deck, like we were making a big cake.
Our project hit a roadblock and it felt like we'd just run into another huge obstacle - as if hitting another 'cake.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: Something that is considered trivial or unimportant
meanings_and_examples.example: He complained about the broken coffee machine, but I told him to chill out; it's just a cake.
